caption: Such an amazing, relaxing way to see the sights of Paris! After several days of walking the city, we were footsore and HOT, so we took Batobus as a way to cool off and see anything we had missed. We were able to easily hop on and off to visit anything we wanted to without any time pressure, and the stops were all within easy distance of the sites we wanted to see. The view from the Seine was unbeatable, and the staff both on land and on water were friendly and helpful.

Best money you will spend in Paris is getting a one or two-day Batobus pass. Takes two hours to do a complete circuit on the Seine River if you just stay on board, or hop on and off as many times as you like during your pass. No bad seats. Great fun. Super convenient and clean. Pluse you get to see things from the river that you might not other see unless you buy a more expensive river cruise. Love the Batobus!!!

Great value and way to travel around Paris. Loved that our tickets were good for 24 hours. Don't expect a tour guide explaining anything, this isn't that type of tour boat. It was ok, we only needed it to get to our stops comfortably, which we did
First impressions: poor and rude behaviour of seller/ guy. You need to Make sure to learn how to behave specifically with the guests/ customers of your city! As you are representatives of Paris.

Very comfortable way for sightseeing in Paris. You get a ticket for a day and you can hop on and off as you please at Paris most iconic landmarks. Seeing the city from the river gives a totally different perspective and helps avoid the traffic :) loved Batobus :)
It's ok. Price for 24 hour-ticket is good, but the view is not. Unclead messy windows doesn't looks nice and you definitely not see everything.

Great way to see the city! Highly recommended over a regular bus tour - no traffic! Makes stops at all the main spots to see in Paris. Boats come entry 15 mins. And even though it's not a guided tour, the crew on some of the boats did share some info over the speakers in English and French.

Good way to get around and see the sites and good value for money. My only complaint was the waiting, we had to queue for an hour to get on board. Two boats came and went without us as they didn't have enough spaces left. Beautiful way to travel and to see the landmarks. It was also fun to people watch, there was so much going on along the river bank. I think we paid €17 each for a 24 hour pass and you can hop on and off at 7 or 8 different stops along the river.

To be honest, there is not a good or bad review, it depends on the staff involved that day and time. Some of them helped me and my family to go into the boat and other ignored me in the most disrespectful way, sadly the most of them were disrespectful.  As a mom I would recommend to assess the “stroller situation” I have a double Cross from THULE, is so freaking practical for traveling and I love it, but if your children are sleeping is better to wait for the boat, because the personal forced me to folded up and placed in a corner, later on they move it and it was just for annoying us, the space was too big.  I guess my expectations were too high, I went to Germany before and everything was stroller or wheels friendly but the door of the train. Traveling with children is amazing and I had a nice time in Paris, but the “Batobus experience” was something I regretted a lot, and Paris is not that pretty from the river level though.  never stop traveling with children:)  The end of the story, my daughter’s stroller was completely wet after the trip:(
We bought a two day ticket and used it many times, visiting all tourist atractions. Its a fun trip, batobus arives every 30 minutes
Cheap boat ticket, good service, you can hop on and off all day. Would recommend.
Was a nice boat ride, could see a lot of landmarks and had 9 stops that were pretty spread out. The boat wasn't too loud like I've experienced in other places.
Brilliant tourist stop. Even with current renovations the location is so iconic. Worth taking a hat if it's sunny

The woman at the station was friendly and spoke several languages. The Batobus is a nice and different was to see another side of Paris. If you travel on the inside of the boat, it can get VERY hot in June
It's great to see u se Batobus to see different parts of Paris along Seine River. We were able to visit no less than 4 areas out of 9 stops in one day. Recommended.

The Batobus is somewhere between a sightseeing tour and a mode of transportation, but I would not say it excels at either. The grimy, opaque windows limit visibility from the interior of the boat. On a cold or rainy day, the condensation completely obscures the view out the window. There is a small back deck, but you will be exposed to the sound and fumes of the engine.  I would recommend the Batobus for someone who definitely plans to use all or most of the stops. But if you are only trying to hit up one or two, you would be better off taking the Metro. If you really want the best view of Paris from the river, look for a boat with cleaner windows, or one that sits higher on the water.
Easy to access around Paris. Very hot in the summer on the boat because it is covered in glass and it heats up under the sun.
Amazing people mover with a friendly staff. I would definitely use the Batobus again to go see all the main destination spots in Paris!

It’s a good deal if you’re sure you can take it more than once. We arrived at the stop just when the staff pulled up the rope. But the staff on board spotted me and my friend and kindly signaled us to board. Or else we would have had to wait in the cold for 30 minutes! Lovely ride and I love how warm the boat was.
Great way to start your paris holiday. Value for money
Bought for 2 days, the next day were waiting for 45 minutes and the service hadn't information about the time of departure...it is expensive to get only one ticket for 27€
Exactly what they say it is. Price seems a bit steep fpr a fragmented tour but the convenience is worth it. And you have 24 hour acces. I'd call  that a goed deal.

Took my parents on this boat as they have difficulty walking. Thought it would be a nice and relaxing way to see the city… it was horrible. For a start, the ticket vending machine does not work at the station. On the boat, there’s barely any shade so you’re in full sun during the whole journey. Boat is quite small and crowded. It’s loud and the view isn’t great due to the shape of the boat. Overall not worth the price and a suffocating experience. I would more so recommend the Bateaux Mouches, which I did some time ago and preferred.

Great, comfortable way to see the city while sitting and enjoying the sun. I had no idea what I was seeing half the trips, but had I done my homework, I would have been more deeply in love with this city.

Parisien friends advised us to use the Batobus rather than the bus or even the boat/food options. Took the daily ticket as a family of 4. Indeed, great way to move between Paris famous spots. Website well done, good frequency of boats in/out, mostly friendly staff & always on time…friends were right 😊

Loved the Batobus experience. Lots of stops, regular service. Like a bus on the river (it’s not a your boat with commentary which suited me fine but the person behind me complained the whole way round!) No toilets on board (as an FYI)

This has to be done by every visitor to Paris. Had a 2 day ticket to hop on and off. So relaxing after so much sight seeing. Ticket said up to 6.30 but we were on until 9. Check that. Also do full run and a night trip. Best value ever. Not to miss.

A great way to travel around. Very convenient service to hop on and off in a few stops between Eiffel Tower and Botanical gardens. The queues at this time of the year (end of May) were very short - all people boarding the boat and seated. The ride is rather slow, so you can relax and take a rest. I would recommend highly to anyone
Easy on off way to get around Paris and see the sights
Cheap and decent way to do a sight seeing tour around Paris.
Really good, could hop on and off and see the sites of Paris

A few points: 1. we purchased a ticket online to avoid standing in line only to discover that we had to validate them first at a ticket office to end up with a printed ticket. So why sell them online in the first place? 2. the 24h Pass sounds nice at first, but as the boats are only operating from 11:30 to 18:30 you can actually only really use it for one afternoon.  It is however nice to hop on and off and see the city from the river.
Nice way to get your bearings straight
Great way to visit the sights on a very hot day

Fantastic, especially during the night when the Eiffel tower and another lights are on. So beautiful and numerous bridges across the Seine river. The journey is around one hour. Take warmer clothes during the night. Unfortunately, famous cathedral Notre Dame looks very sad, now.
Its a great inexpensive way to get around Paris.  You can use it as many times as you want during the time you have it for. Just make sure you ffg ind out when the ladt one runs as t night

Great way to explore the center of Paris.  This tourist boat hits eight stops, I think, in a continuous loop.  It's about a 20 minute or so wait between boats and makes a great way to visit Notre Dame, the Louvre, the Eiffel Tower and more in its own very scenic way.  We stayed near Notre Dame and had a stop very conveniently located near our vacation rental.  Price was very reasonable (19 Euros) for a two day pass, and we got our money's worth, for sure!  Highly recommend!

Overall a good way to visit some of the most iconic sights. Negatives: we had to wait almost 2 hours to get on a boat downriver from the Eiffel Tower as all the boats were full. Not great in the August heat after a day sightseeing.
